benchmark_details.name: NaijaSenti: A Nigerian Twitter Sentiment Corpus for Multilingual Sentiment Analysis
benchmark_details.overview: NaijaSenti is the first large-scale human-annotated Twitter sentiment dataset for the four most widely spoken languages in Nigeria—Hausa, Igbo, Nigerian-Pidgin, and Yorùbá—consisting of around 30,000 annotated tweets per language, including a significant fraction of code-mixed tweets.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To foster research on sentiment analysis in under-represented languages and provide a benchmark dataset for multilingual sentiment analysis.

data.source: Tweets collected using the Twitter Academic API and annotated by native speakers
data.annotation: Manually annotated by native speakers with a training and quality control process.

methodology.calculation: F1 scores calculated based on classification tasks for sentiment analysis.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better model performance in classifying sentiment.
methodology.baseline_results: AfriBERTa achieves the best performance across all languages.
